alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 10:36PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Lubbock County. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a thunderstorm. Minor flooding is already occurring over much of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over much of the city of Lubbock and northwest to Shallowater. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are possible in the advisory area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Shallowater, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock International Airport, New Deal, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding!
